DataElement.preferredName: Person Agent QTcB Prolongation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not agents which prolong QTc measurements are being received by the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Agent QTcB Prolongation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to agents a person is receiving which prolong QTc measurements for the purpose of eligibility on a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Agent QTcB Prolongation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval corrected for heart rate using Bazett's formula is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC):Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval corrected for heart rate using Bazett's formula is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving drugs th
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving drugs that prolong the QTc?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1302
ReferenceDocuments.description: If QTc is greater than or equal to 460 msec, is the patient receiving drugs that prolong the QTc?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient being treated with medications known to cause QTc interval prolongation within 7 days prior to starting study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1602 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has/Will the patient receive(d) unapproved medications known to cause QTc interval prolongation within 7 days of start date?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ABTC 1302 study in Rave which needed NA as a PV. mc 5/12/16
